main event: A CIRVIS report of an object observed in the Pacific on 16 March 1964, described as being about the brightness of a first magnitude star and moving very fast to the East.
interesting points: The object was observed at an elevation of 70 degrees,.The sighting lasted for a brief period but the length of observation was not reported,.The source of the report was military air,.The object was considered as a possible satellite,.Only one object was reported in the sighting.
sighted object: object of about the brightness of a first magnitude star
